problem.markdown:
>> Which statement is NOT true below?<< ( ) In systems like flow lines, the machines are unreliable and the buffers are finite. ( X ) In supply chain, most products are assemblies, and there are usually a lot of errors in assemblies. It is better to have downstream inventory. ( ) If a system is a single reliable machine, the time a part spend in a machine and the operation time of the machine are the same. ( ) Whenever we analyze systems with machines that have geometric up and down time, we will treat the operation time as the time unit. This will simplify notation.
[explanation] In supply chains, most products are assemblies, and the there’s usually a lot of error in an assembly. It is better to have upstream inventory, because it takes less space and thus cheaper. [explanation]
